The royal cubit consisted of 7 palms, not 6, and is described as the distance between a man’s elbow and the tip of his extended middle finger. Its usual equivalence is 52.4 centimeters. One hundred royal cubits was called a khet. The aroura was equal to a square of 1 khet by 1 khet, or 10,000

Herodotus tells us that each man received a square parcel of land, but while we know them as arouras (= rectangles), the expression of these plots in terms of squares 1 khet by 1 khet might explain this discrepancy. 54
